page.title: 06Religion
page.content: St.Peters church is not like other churches because it used to be a school too. Reverend Egerton was the last person to own Hextable. When he died,it was sold,but his son saved some land to build St.Peters church on. There was a folding door across the hall,so the church became two classrooms,each with a fireplace. This was also used as a school,and so on Sundays,screens were put over the work and an altar put out. There is still a school bell which is rusty now. A proper school was built,so St.Peters became just a church and later a church hall with the playground as a carpark because a new church part was built in 1978. It is unusual because it is octaganal and has a pointed wooden roof,the chairs pack away and the stainless steel floor can be moved wherever it is wanted.
